SEARCH
Package FLBConvertor

Class FLBConverter.Plugin

java.lang.Object
FLBConvertor.FLBConverter.Plugin
Direct Known Subclasses:
FLBConverter.SpecialPlugin
Enclosing class:
FLBConverter
static class FLBConverter.Plugin extends Object
This class helps us process the plugins and directives. Each plugin will have an instance of this class. We track the plugin type so we can get the order of output correct

    • pluginType

      public FLBConverter.PluginType pluginType
      pluginType is an enumeration to make it easy to determine the plugin type

    • name

      private String name
      name represents the name plugin

    • attributes

      FLBConverter.HashMapArray attributes
      As certain attributes are allowed to reoccur such as the rules in the modifier filter plugin we store each attribute name as a HashMap containing array lists. We've declared our our own class for this to simplify the use of the definition

  • Constructor Details

    • Plugin

      public Plugin(FLBConverter.PluginType type)
      Standard constructor
      Parameters:
      type - this the enumeration showing the type of plugin being handled

  • Method Details

    • attributeCountByType

      public int attributeCountByType()
      get the number of different attributes types (some plugins allow multiple occurrences of the same attribute)
      Returns:
      the number of attributes held by this plugin. We only count one unique occurence of an attribute

    • indenter

      String indenter(int depth)
      builds an indent string that will be accepted by YAML
      Parameters:
      depth - how many levels of indetation
      Returns:
      the YAML suitable indentation characters

    • checkForInclusion

      static boolean checkForInclusion(String line, int lineNo)
      We examine the line to see if the @includes is used. Fluent Bit allows us to set attribute elements with an @includes, however in YAML its use is a lot more restrictive. So when we encounter its use we need to log it
      Parameters:
      line - the line to examine
      lineNo - position in the source file
      Returns:
      true if an includes is identified

    • toIdiomaticForm

      private String toIdiomaticForm(String attributeName)
      converts the attribute name to its idiomatc form if the option is enabled
      Parameters:
      attributeName - name to convert
      Returns:
      returns the attribute key in a format dictated by the idiomatv

    • add

      public void add(String attribute, int lineNo)
      Each attribute is processed into this instance of a plugin. If any issues are identified such as the use of the @includes feature this is logged to info. We also deal with any of the foible such as quoting wildcards and dummy attributes
      Parameters:
      attribute - the attribute line from the source file
      lineNo - the line number for this attribute in the source file

    • writePrefix

      String writePrefix()
      Provides a correctly formatted plugin name - we declare this separatelty so anything that is handled using the plugin object such as a service can have this action overridden
      Returns:
      returns the name label with correct indentation for the YAML config

    • write

      public String write()
      We build the YAML representation of the plugin, iterating over the data structure and handling the possibility of having multiple attributes of the same type
      Returns:
      string containing the plugin in YAML format
